clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Study Of Riluzole In Patients With Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
clinical_study.official_title: An Investigation of the Effects of Riluzole in Patients With Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)

brief_summary.textblock: This open label study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of riluzole in patients with PTSD. Patients will receive riluzole 50mg twice per day orally for 12 weeks as outpatient, with a one month follow up at week 16.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinician Administered PTSD Scale (CAPS)
primary_outcome.description: The CAPS is a standardized clinician-rated instrument to assess the presence and severity of PTSD symptoms. The scores range from 0 (minimum) to 80 (mazimum). Higher scores reflect worse symptoms.

other_outcome.measure: Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptoms - Self-Report (QIDS-SR)

arm_group.description: Riluzole 50 mg orally twice per day

overall_official.affiliation: National Center for PTSD / Yale University

facility.name: Clinical Neuroscience Division, National Center for PTSD

group.title: Riluzole Open Label
group.description: Subjects diagnosed with PTSD will receive riluzole, 50 mg taken orally twice daily (BID) for 12 weeks

baseline.population: 18 participants started the study and 9 participants were randomized into the single arm of the study. However, only 8 participants completed the treatment. Since there was some treatment data collected on the 9th participant, he/she was included in the analysis.

reported_events.desc: The reporting of the adverse events reflects that one participant could have experienced more than one adverse event. For example, one participant experienced both dry mouth and lightheadedness. Similarly, three participants could have experienced chest pain. Thus, it may seem like the number of participants that experienced various adverse events does not match up to the number of participants in the participant flow. We analyzed 9 participants total and recorded their AEs in this section.
